flow.descriptionCdata:
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.010d7a63-f3d8-42a4-b0a7-f58d2e53ff86.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
    targetHost - The target host to ping
    packetSize - The size of the ping packet
    packetCount - The number of packets to send. 
    timeout - The timeout in miliseconds for the Local Ping operation. Default is 90000.
    ipVersion - IP version forced to the ping command executed on the target host. For Windows -4 or -6 parameters will be added.On Linux will be used ping or ping6. For Solaris -A inet or -A inet6 parameters will be added. For empty string the operation will decide what format to use if targetHost is an ip literal; if targetHost is given as a hostname default 'ping' command will be used on each operating system.
Values\: 4, 6, '' (empty string without quotes).
Default\: '' (empty string without quotes).

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully
    failure - The command could not be executed

Returns\:
    packetsSent - The number of packets sent
    packetsReceived - The number of packets received
    percentagePacketsLost - The percentage of packets lost
    transmissionTimeMin - The minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeMax - The maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeAvg - The average time taken for transmitting the packet
    returnResult - The raw output of the command
    returnCode - The return code from the executed command
    error - the STDERR of the command
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.256c9918-61a2-424c-948c-217dc1e4735c.description=
Tries to make a connection to the request port.

Input Parameters\:
    host - hostname or IP address of the target host.
    port - port to connect to.
    portType - the type of port (TCP or UDP).
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for tcp connection and for udp response.

Responses\:
    port opened - a successful connection was made.
    port closed - unable to make a connection.
    host not found - could not resolve hostname to a valid IP address.

Extra Results\:
    addresses - list of addresses returned from DNS.
    aliases - list of aliases returned from DNS.
    addresspinged - actual IP address pinged.
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.424ac05e-72da-4f2e-8963-8454541d8c3b.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.464b4de1-313a-4020-93f0-5010daf76646.description=
The operation runs a SSH command on the host.

Inputs\:
    host - Hostname or ip address.
    port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input (in a syntax like host\:port), if this exists.
    command - The command to execute.
    arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
    pty - Whether to use pty.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file on the RAS host. The private key file must be in OpenSSH format.
    username - Username to connect as.
    password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000 ( 90 seconds ).
    characterSet - The character encoding used for input stream encoding from the target machine. 
Valid values\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  
Default value\: UTF-8. 
    closeSession - If "false" the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If "true" the ssh session used by this operation will be closed.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: true.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the STDERR of the command if something went wrong or STDOUT otherwise.
    STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
    STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns a 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code.

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully.
    failure - The command could not be executed.

Notes\:
1. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel.
2. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). After update you must restart the Studio or Central service.
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.5dc9941a-45c9-4194-82b2-4f2dbe0d804d.description=Starts deploying an agent on an unmanaged server. This operation is supported from SA version 10.1 (sas101). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverIPAddress - The IP address of the server on which the agent will be installed. protocol - Set the protocol used to login to the server on which the agent will be installed. If set to 'Select automatically', the job will try every protocol possible and use the first which is available. Possible values are\: ssh, telnet, netbt, rlogin. protocolPort - Set the port for the protocol specified above. If not set, the default port for the protocol will be used. username - The username for the server on which the agent will be installed. password - The password for the server on which the agent will be installed. rootPassword - Specify in case authentication is done as a non-root user, to become root (UNIX only). Set the value 'sudo' if the user is in the sudoers group, otherwise set the root password. actionType - Select the action type\: 'check' for checking if prerequisite conditions are fulfilled, 'download' for checking if prerequisite conditions are fulfilled and staging(downloading) the Agent installer binary or 'install' for checking if the prerequisite conditions are fulfilled, staging(downloading) the Agent installer binary and running the Agent installer binary. Default is 'install'. targetOSClass - Set the target OS class for the server on which the agent will be installed. Valid values are\: Windows, UNIX. realmName - The name of the realm. If set, the gateway inputs will be ignored. realmID - The ID of the realm. If set, the 'realmName' and the gateway inputs will be ignored. gatewayName - The name of the gateway. If set, the 'gatewayAddressInfo' must be specified. gatewayID - The ID of the gateway. If set, the 'gatewayAddressInfo' must be specified and the 'gatewayName' will be ignored. gatewayAddressInfo - The IP addresses and proxy ports of the gateways, in the format \:, separated by 'separator'. The IP addresses can be either version 4 (e.g. 192.168.55.22\:100) or version 6, which must be enclosed in brackets (e.g. [ff\:\:]\:100). If set, the gateway name or ID must be specified. noStartAgent - Do not start agent after installation. Default value is false. ignorePrerequisiteCheckFailures - Specify whether the deployment process should ignore any prerequisites check failures and proceed with the Agent installation. Default value is false. setTime - Set system time from HP Server Automation core. Default value is false. installMSI - Install Windows installer (MSI) if required (Windows only). Default value is false. reboot - Reboot at completion of successful install if warranted (Windows only). Default value is false. installRPM - Install Red Hat Package Manager (RPM) if required (AIX/Solaris only). Default value is false. resetConf - Reset agent configuration file to default settings. Default value is false. noOpswareGateway - Indicate that no Opsware gateway is necessary. Default value is false. overwriteInstaller - Specify whether HP SA Agent installer binary should be overwritten in case already staged. Default value is false. logLevel - The log level. Log levels are\: error, trace, warning, info. Default value is error. forceFullHardwareRegistration - Force full hardware registration. Default value is false. forceSoftwareRegistration - Force software registration. Default value is false. noReachabilityCheck - Suppress agent reachability check. Default value is false. noAnonymousSSL - Disable anonymous SSL. Applies to dormant agent only. Default value is false. forceNewDevice - Force creation of new device record if conflict found. Default value is false. failOnHardwareRegistrationError - Fail if initial hardware registration fails (do not go dormant). Default value is false. doNotOpenWindowsFirewall - Set 'true' to not open Windows firewall for core-agent communications. Default value is false. remediateSoftwarePolicy - Perform a remediate of Software Policies after install. Default value is false. softwarePolicyID - The ID of the software policy to attach. fingerprint - Fingerprint of the peer's certificate. Default value is false. installerOptions - Set the command line arguments for the HP SA Agent installer. userTag - An user provided tag applicable to this job. timeout - The maximum time, in seconds, within which this method should complete and the operation should return. The job will fail with a timeout error if the Install HP SA Agent operation does not complete in the given number of seconds. The default value is 0 (no timeout). separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The time zone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Outputs\: jobId - The ID of the job created for installing a HP SA Agent on a server. Responses\: success - The operation has completed successfully. failure - The operation has failed. f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.a1648c5e-0011-46cb-91d5-d73a20ee5208.prompt=HostName\: f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.b99b6274-d59d-4ffd-88e1-cefda3d0a991.description=
Copies files between two remote machines through secure SSH.

Inputs\:
    sourcePath - The absolute path to the source file.
    sourceHost - The host of the source file.
    sourcePort - The port used for connecting to the source host.
    sourceUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the source file.
    sourcePassword - The password for connecting to the host of the source file. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
    sourcePrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the source host.
    destinationPath - The absolute path to the destination file.
    destinationHost - The host of the destination file.
    destinationPort - The port used for connecting to the destination host.
    destinationUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the destination file.
    destinationPassword - The password for connecting to the host of the destination file.
    destinationPrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the destination host. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
    connectionTimeout - The time to wait for the command to complete (in seconds).
Default value\: 20.
Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output and contains the "Copy completed successfully" message if operation successfully completes, or an exception message otherwise.
    returnCode - It is 0 if operation successfully completes, -1 otherwise.
    exception - It contains an exception message if something went wrong.

Responses\:
    success - The file was copied successfully.
    failure - The file could not be copied.

Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file from a Windows machine to a  Linux machine\:
        sourcePath\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
        sourceHost\: server1.example.com
        sourcePort\: 22
        sourceUsername\: username1
        sourcePasword\: password1
        destinationPath\: /root/example.txt
        destinationHost\: server2.example.com
        destinationPort\: 22
        destinationUsername\: username2
        destinationPassword\: password2
2. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file from a Linux machine to a Windows machine\:
        sourcePath\: /root/example.txt
        sourceHost\: server2.example.com
        sourcePort\: 22
        sourceUsername\: username2
        sourcePasword\: password2
        destinationPath\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
        destinationHost\: server1.example.com
        destinationPort\: 22
        destinationUsername\: username1
        destinationPassword\: password1

Notes\:
1. This operation connects to the source server, makes a temp local copy of the source file, connects to the destination server, copies the file there and finally deletes the tmp file.
2. The timeout input will be set for the connection to the source server then to the connection of the destination server and therefore the execution time of the operation might take longer than the specified timeout.
f41bd190-3487-4ab0-a963-0543fb6ca43a.c75b1c1f-087f-4438-b00c-646d3123de02.prompt=HostName\:
flow.name: installHPSAAgent
